Package io.github.cjstehno.ersatz.cfg

Interface Expectations

All Superinterfaces:
AnyExpectations, DeleteExpectations, GetExpectations, HeadExpectations, OptionsExpectations, PatchExpectations, PostExpectations, PutExpectations
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExpectationsImpl
public interface Expectations extends AnyExpectations, GetExpectations, HeadExpectations, PostExpectations, PutExpectations, DeleteExpectations, PatchExpectations, OptionsExpectations
The Expectations interface is the root element of the expectation configuration, which provides the ability to define request expectations and responses for test interactions.

Internal expectation matching is done using Hamcrest Matchers - the methods without explicit Matches provide one as a convenience based on the property and value type (see method description). All configured matchers must match for a specific expectation to be considered a match and if there are multiple matching expectations, the first one configured will be the one considered as the match.

    • request

      default Request request(HttpMethod method, String path, Consumer<Request> consumer)
      Allows configuration of request expectation matching any request method using the provided Consumer<Request>. The Consumer<Request> will have an instance of Request passed into it for configuration.
      Parameters:
      method - the request method
      path - the expected request path
      consumer - the configuration consumer
      Returns:
      a Request configuration object

    • request

    • request

      Request request(HttpMethod method, PathMatcher pathMatcher, Consumer<Request> consumer)
      Allows configuration of request expectation matching any request method with a path matching the provided matcher. The consumer will be used to provide addition expectations on the request.
      Parameters:
      method - the request method
      pathMatcher - the patch matcher
      consumer - the configuration consumer
      Returns:
      a Request configuration object
